intro: Bellevalia artensis, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Bellevalia artensis is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
